    • Method Detail

      • anyOf

        public static PathFilter anyOf(Collection<PathFilter> pathFilterCollection)
        Creates a new path filter which returns the logical OR of a collection of path filters. A short-circuit algorithm is used, thus not all filters are guaranteed to run. For example, if the first result is true, none of the remaining filters are run. This is important if the filters are stateful.

        As a special case, if the input list has exactly one element, it is returned unchanged.

        anyOf(Arrays.asList(filter1, filter2, filter3)).accept(path, depth)
        is equivalent to...
        filter1.accept(path, depth) || filter2.accept(path, depth) || filter3.accept(path, depth)

        Parameters:
        pathFilterCollection - collection of path filters to combine. Must not be null, empty, or contain null elements.
        Returns:
        new path filter which returns the logical OR of the input path filters
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if pathFilterCollection (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if number of elements in pathFilterCollection is zero
        See Also:
        allOf(Collection), FileFilterUtils.anyOf(Collection), FileFilterUtils.allOf(Collection)

      • allOf

        public static PathFilter allOf(Collection<PathFilter> pathFilterCollection)
        Creates a new path filter which returns the logical AND of a collection of path filters. A short-circuit algorithm is used, thus not all filters are guaranteed to run. For example, if the first result is false, none of the remaining filters are run. This is important if the filters are stateful.

        As a special case, if the input list has exactly one element, it is returned unchanged.

        allOf(Arrays.asList(filter1, filter2, filter3)).accept(path, depth)
        is equivalent to...
        filter1.accept(path, depth) && filter2.accept(path, depth) && filter3.accept(path, depth)

        Parameters:
        pathFilterCollection - collection of path filters to combine. Must not be null, empty, or contain null elements.
        Returns:
        new path filter which returns the logical AND of the input path filters
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if pathFilterCollection (or any element) is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if number of elements in pathFilterCollection is zero
        See Also:
        anyOf(Collection), FileFilterUtils.anyOf(Collection), FileFilterUtils.allOf(Collection)
